intro.description: This guide walks you though the process of importing a C/C++ project into CDT.

item.title: C/C++ workbench setup
item.description: Start by setting up the CDT development environment.

subitem.label: Open C/C++ perspective.

item.title: Creating a C/C++ project
item.description: Create a C++ or C project by choosing one of the following wizards.

subitem.label: Click File > New > C++ Project to launch the new C++ project wizard.
Click File > New > C Project to launch the new C project wizard.
Choose Executable > Hello World C/C++ Example from the Project types list.
Type a project name, set its location, and select a Toolchain, then click Next.
Enter Basic Project information, then click Next.
Select platforms and configurations to show in the Run/Debug menus, click Finish.

item.title: Importing files to the project
item.description: For a project to work it needs files. In this step you import your old project files into your new C/C++ project.

subitem.label: Click File > Import and then use one of the following import methods.
To import files from another project, click General > Existing Projects into Workspace.
To import files from the file system, click General > File System.

item.title: Building projects and inspecting files
item.description: Build the program to create a binary and examine it in Outline and Project Explorer views.

subitem.label: Click Project > Build All to create a binary of your source file.
In the Project Explorer view, open the Binaries element and examine the program's binary.
Open the .cpp file in the project and examine the Outline view.

item.title: Setup project properties
item.description: With the project imported and able to build, its time now to reset some project properties for easier development.

subitem.label: Right-click the project name in the Project Explorer view, then click Properties.
Click C/C++ Indexer, then select Full C/C++ Indexer from the Select Indexer list.

item.title: Running the program
item.description: Create a run configuration that defines how the program is launched. Note you can define multiple run configurations if desired, each with its own settings.

subitem.label: Select the project and click Run As > Open Run Dialog... to launch the program.
Create a run configuration by double-clicking the C/C++ Local Application item.
Type a configuration name in the Name box.
If no binary name appears in the C/C++ Application box, click Search Project to select one in the Program Selection dialog.
Click Apply, then click Run to launch the program. The Console view displays the program output.
